unit: Unit 1: The Exploration and Settlement of North America
targets: I can identify European powers seeking land claims in North America after 1600.
I can identify the motivations related to the exploration and settlement of North America.
I can identify the challenges related to the exploration and settlement of North America.
I can identify the achievements related to the exploration and settlement of North America.
I can analyze European exploration of North America.
I can analyze European colonization of North America.
I can explain the significance of land claims made in North America by European powers after 1600.
I can describe the effects of European land claims on Native Americans.
I can compare and contrast the motivations related to exploration and settlement of North America.
I can compare and contrast the challenges related to exploration and settlement of North America.
I can compare and contrast the achievements related to exploration and settlement of North America.

chapter: Chapter 7: The French and Indian War
targets: I can identify the Native American tribes living in the Ohio River Valley.

I can explain the purpose of the Albany Congress.

I can explain the effects of the French and Indian War.

I can describe the Sugar Act.
I can describe the Stamp Act.
I can describe the Townshend Acts.
I can describe the Tea Act.
I can describe the Quartering Act.

I can identify Loyalists.

I can explain how key ideas expressed, like 'taxation without representation' (John Otis), influenced the American Revolution.

I can explain efforts to mobilize support for the American Revolution by the Committees of Correspondence.
I can explain how key ideas expressed in propaganda created by Paul Revere influenced the American Revolution.
I can compare and contrast viewpoints of Loyalists and Patriots.

I can evaluate the arguments of Loyalists against independence from Britain.

chapter: Chapter 10: Early Challenges and the Articles of Confederation
targets: I can identify the Articles of Confederation.
